thread.title: It's madness! Roy Keane insists "there's no way" Wayne Rooney should make Chinese Super League switch
thread.title_full: It's madness! Roy Keane insists "there's no way" Wayne Rooney should make Chinese Super League switch

author: Jacob Murtagh
title: It's madness! Roy Keane insists "there's no way" Wayne Rooney should make Chinese Super League switch
text:
Sport It's madness! Roy Keane insists "there's no way" Wayne Rooney should make Chinese Super League switch The Manchester United star's agent flew to Beijing this week to try and engineer a lucrative deal for his client Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Roy Keane doesn't agree Wayne Rooney should move to China Share this video Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Roy Keane has hit out at Wayne Rooney after the Manchester United skipper's agent flew to Beijing to try and engineer a lucrative move to the Chinese Super League. 
Paul Stretford travlled to the Chinese capital this week, having been given the green light to secure a move for the United stalwart. He is ready to take internal flights to extend talks with interested clubs. 
Although no deal has yet been struck, Rooney has been told he can leave United by next Tuesdayâ€™s Chinese Super League transfer deadline if Stretford can clinch a deal for his client there. 
Rooney missed Wednesday night's Europa League win in St Etienne, but Red Devils legend Keane claims the England ace can still cut it at the top. Wayne Rooney could be heading for the exit (Photo: REUTERS) Rooney's agent Paul Stretford has flown to China 
"There's no way Wayne Rooney should be going to China," said Keane, speaking on ITV's Champions League highlights show. 
"He can still play football and still play at the top level in England, Germany, Spain, Italy. Madness. 
"Going to China? Madness. He's 31-years of age. There's plenty left yet for Wayne Rooney to do in Europe. "I don't think he's short of money is he." 
Stretford is understood to be talking to a series of clubs but recognises he needs to meet a string of criteria for his client and United to make a deal happen. Roy Keane insists Rooney can still cut it at the top (Photo: ITV) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
